attributes.additional_details:
Save Penrith's Fire Engine

Responsible department: Department for Communities and Local Government

The proposed cut to one of Penrith's two fire engines is due to Council cuts to Cumbria Fire & Rescue Service budget.

Longer response times will put the public and fire fighters LIVES in more danger.
Penrith’s local homes and businesses will be put at a greater risk due to less fire engines and longer response times.

This is your emergency service so please sign and be counted.
